column4: How do I mass rename but keep a part of the filename? Ex: asdf?=video1.wmv, asdf?=video2.wmv asdf?=video3.wmv I want to remove asdf?= and keep everything after that saved.
I know that but what parameters?
well you could probably do something like (untested, but will just say what it will do unless you remove the -n):  rename -n 's/^asdf\?\=//' *
or from backups or from some other reference of coures
run "yes", you will see it just echoes "y" over and over
well the easiest way to fix this is backup and reinstall.  Otherwise use a live cd as a reference and restore the permissions
did you read what I said?
well I said to use a live cd as a reference if you choose to do it that way.  But really backups and a reinstall would be faster if you aren't comfortable doing this.
also please address people you reply to
just put their nick at the beginning of what you say
